summary: "Silence" is a 2016 historical drama film directed by Martin Scorsese, based on a novel by Shūsaku Endō. It tells the story of two 17th-century Jesuit priests who travel to Japan to find their missing mentor and spread Christianity during a time of persecution. The film stars Andrew Garfield and Adam Driver. Production took over two decades due to many setbacks. It received critical acclaim but was not a commercial success. This is Scorsese's third film exploring religious themes.
title: Silence (2016 film)
